p: The virus was first observed in horses in 1935 after outbreaks in Columbia, Venezuela and Trinidad, and was isolated in 1938. In the 1960s, over 200,000 human cases and 100,000 equine deaths were reported in Colombia and smaller epidemics occurred in Venezuela and Mexico. Between 75,000 and 100,000 infections were reported in Venezuela and Colombia in 1995. The outbreaks usually occur after a season of heavy rains, due to increases in the mosquito population (Weaver etÂ al. 2004).
